page.title: 20THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Near the village pond is an old stone-built building. Originally it was the workhouse where, in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries, penniless and homeless people were housed. Now it is a meeting place for the many activities that take place in the village. A jumble sale, a whist drive or a disco all take place here. On Thursday evenings the Brownies use it as a base for their activities. It is here that a painting class is held and when the Summer Flower is held at the end of June, the scent of sweet peas and roses is wonderful.
